intro: Halea repanda, commonly known as the broadleaf halea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the United States, particularly found in the southwestern regions of Texas and New Mexico. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Halea repanda typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
